isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING SLEEPER LIGHTING AND ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - Bunk Fluorescent and Reading Lights W/60 Inch Cantilever Sleeper

svcproc.title: Bunk Fluorescent and Reading Lights W/60 Inch Cantilever Sleeper
svcproc.para: When the sleeper dome light switch is ON, and the bunk dome light switch is moved at either of the two locations, current will flow from battery stud B2, through circuit 14AP, fuse F8 - D, circuit 14AX, 14P, fuse K2, and circuit 63F to the bunk fluorescent light. The ground circuit is 11U or 11P between the two bunk dome light switches, and circuit 11C, sleeper dome light switch, and 11G to sleeper ground.

When the left lower bunk reading light switch is turned ON, current will flow from battery stud B2, through circuit 14AP, fuse F8 - D, circuit 14AX, 14P, 14N, fuse L3, circuit 63AC, and 63A to the reading light switch and lamp. The ground circuit is 11Z and 11L to sleeper ground.

When the left upper bunk reading light switch is turned ON, current will flow from battery stud B2, through circuit 14AP, fuse F8 - D, circuit 14AX, 14P, 14N, fuse L3, circuit 63AC, and 63A to the reading light switch and lamp. The ground circuit is 11L to sleeper ground.
